project.teaser: SEHRENE’s new electrothermal energy storage (ETES) concept is designed to store renewable electricity (RE) and heat and to restitute it as needed. It is very energy-efficient (80-85%), is geographically independant and uses no critical raw materials. It enables 8-12 times...
project.objective: SEHRENE’s new electrothermal energy storage (ETES) concept is designed to store renewable electricity (RE) and heat and to restitute it as needed. It is very energy-efficient (80-85%), is geographically independant and uses no critical raw materials. It enables 8-12 times longer storage duration than Li-ion, with LCOS of 80 – 137 €/MWh, depending on the use-case. This is lower than pumped hydro, the lowest-cost commercial electricity storage. Its lifetime of 20-30 years is 2 – 3x longer than Li-ion. A TRL4 prototype and the digital twins of 3 full use-cases will be delivered: (i) ceramics plant storing excess, on-site PV power in a micro-grid and industrial waste-heat for continuous green H2 production and self-consumption, (ii) a smart-grid, and (iii) a geothermal power plant. The ETES integrates: (i) a novel heat-pump design with a coefficient of performance of 50% the theoretical maximum, (ii) a novel thermal energy storage system with energy density of 90 kWh/m3 (+30%), containing phase-change material in a novel metallic Kelvin cells-like foam and (iii) ORC with novel operating parameters. New digital tools will optimise the energy management of the storage and facilitate investment decisions by potential end-users taking LCA and technico-economic factors into account. SEHRENE unites 5 R&D teams with top-level expertise in prototyping, physics-based modelling, characterisation and digital twins of thermo-electric systems, thermal storage and AI-based energy-management; 1 RE producer, 1 DSO, 1 ceramics company, 1 SME developing decision-support tools, and 1 SME for dissemination and communication. The exploitation plan aims to implement the solution in the first factory in 2029. SEHRENE’s market penetration will enable to capture 1% of the market by 2040 avoiding 90Mm3 of NG and 15Mt CO2/year. R&D and industrial partners project to generate 5.8M€ in revenues by 2035 from sales of heat pumps, thermal storage, ORC, licenses to R&D results and consulting services.
project.title: Store Electricity and Heat foR climatE Neutral Europe
project.keywords: Thermal storage, Thermoelectric storage, Heat pump, Kelvin foam, Lattice structure, Power-to-X, Digital twin, EMS, decision-support, LCA, technico-economic analysis, corrosion, phase-change material

result.title: Project management handbook with templates & guide (initial)
result.description: Description of the project management strategy and method related to T1.1 : this deliverable will include among other things: a Gantt chart and a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS); A schedule per task, responsible partner related subtasks, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Description of operational management related to T1.2. Details on IP management, organization and follow-up related to consortium management

result.title: ETES and components requirements and KPIs for each use case
result.description: The aim of the deliverable is to provide a comprehensive and documented set of specifications that outline the specific requirements for the ETES system and its components for each use cases and this will provide inputs and the complete vision required for ETES development(WP3), modeling, and Digital Twin (WP5). This deliverable will also include KPIs identified, under task 2.3, to evaluate the functionalities of the ETES system

result.title: Project management handbook with tempales & guide (first update)
result.description: This deliverable updates, according to the project evolutions: the Gantt chart and Work Breakdown Structure (WBS); A schedule per task, responsible partner related subtasks, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks.

result.title: PCM selection for ETES
result.description: Review of existing PCM available and suitable for SEHRENE applications. The different familys of PCM will be described and main criterias for selection defined and calculated.

result.title: Review of corrosion and ageing issues of materials (SoA) and critical paramters defined
result.description: State of the art on main issues on PCM regarding corrosion with Al surfaces (related to T4.2)

category.title: energy conversion
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/energy and fuels/energy conversion

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
